intro: Arcytophyllum peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian sage, is a perennial shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
